course_title: Topics in History and Text: Rome & China Compared
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 12 / Seats Avail: 12Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as CL 285 1, CHN 285 1)
This course will compare and contrast the cultures of ancient Rome and China. We will analyze the similarities and differences in their political systems, economies, social structures, ideologies of rulership, religions, military operations, organizations of the empire, historiographies, urban developments, art and visualization, and cultural practices. This course will both benefit from a continuously growing scholarship on comparative studies involving Rome and China and explore new comparative possibilities.
course_description: The course demonstrates how literary, artistic, and/or cinematic texts, when understood in relation to the context of their production, can be used to study selected historical themes.
